name: X32-behringer
tagline: This GIT repo (C language) is for X32 Behringer mixing consoles. Additional details, documentation and executables can be downloaded from my website.
body:
# X32-Behringer
---
I made the acquisition of a Behringer X32 standard console for my music studio and gig needs.

Great unit! is all I can say. No or very minor problems with it, a pretty good sound (to me anyways), easy to manage and learn, embedding great effects and a lot of capabilities, including being controllable through OSC protocol.

## OSC (Open Sound Control)
I decided to spend a little time (well... initially :-)) understanding the OSC programming aspects to interface with the X32, and have it do things for me. This work resulted in an updated, [unofficial X32 OSC protocol](https://sites.google.com/site/patrickmaillot/docs/X32-OSC.pdf) document which I hope will help many others.

## X32 Utilities
Over time, I developed utilities for my own use and help other users. These utilities running under different operating systems. Some Raspberry and Mac/OSX versions are available, although testing has been minimal with Mac. 

My [website](https://sites.google.com/site/patrickmaillot/x32) includes several utilities you can just click on to download the latest Windows, Mac or Linux executable versions of. This [Git repository](https://github.com/pmaillot/X32-Behringer) holds many of the utilities' source code, and you are welcome to download/clone, modify and bring enhancements to the proposed programs.

-Patrick-Gilles Maillot
